      boolean unregisterExtensions(java.util.function.BiPredicate<? super java.lang.String,? super ExtensionComponentAdapter> extensionClassFilter, boolean stopAfterFirstMatch)
      Unregisters extensions for which the specified predicate returns false.
      boolean unregisterExtensions(java.util.function.BiPredicate<? super java.lang.String,? super ExtensionComponentAdapter> extensionClassFilter, boolean stopAfterFirstMatch, java.util.List<java.lang.Runnable> listenerCallbacks)
      Unregisters extensions for which the specified predicate returns false and collects the callables for listener invocation into the given list so that listeners can be called later.

      Use another solution to unregister not applicable extension, because this method instantiates all extensions.

      • unregisterExtension

        void unregisterExtension(java.lang.Class<? extends T> extensionClass)
        Unregisters an extension of the specified type. Please note that you can deregister service specifying empty implementation class. Consider to use ExtensionNotApplicableException instead.

      • unregisterExtensions

        boolean unregisterExtensions(java.util.function.BiPredicate<? super java.lang.String,? super ExtensionComponentAdapter> extensionClassFilter,
                             boolean stopAfterFirstMatch)
        Unregisters extensions for which the specified predicate returns false. Consider to use ExtensionNotApplicableException instead.

      • unregisterExtensions

        boolean unregisterExtensions(java.util.function.BiPredicate<? super java.lang.String,? super ExtensionComponentAdapter> extensionClassFilter,
                             boolean stopAfterFirstMatch,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.Runnable> listenerCallbacks)
        Unregisters extensions for which the specified predicate returns false and collects the callables for listener invocation into the given list so that listeners can be called later.
